alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Johnson; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Morgan, northern Johnson and Elliott Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bruin to Ebon. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bruin and Culver around 255 PM EDT. Index and Wrigley around 305 PM EDT. Cottle, Lenox, Gordon Ford and Lick Branch around 310 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Elamton, Florress, Elkfork, Steele, Dingus, Silverhill, Jeptha, Crockett, Ophir, Mima, Relief, Moon, Elna, Redbush, Gillem Branch, Barnrock, Flatgap, Keaton, Winifred, Kerz and Sip. THIS INCLUDES U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 13 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Kentucky.
